reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plitvice with its waterfalls is really worth a visit! You do not believe that it is for real until you see it.
reviews.title: Nice and clean

reviews.text: The hotel was nice an clean but somewhat unpersonal. It had been renovated in a style that is in accordance with its roots.
reviews.title: Incredible Scenery
Lovely location
reviews.text: Most hotels in the Plitvice Lakes area are fairly pricey, this being no exception. The only rooms left were superior, which we took, it was huge, with a settee and TV area. It's obviously been a while since the rooms were decorated but still they were clean and well equipped. The staff were friendly and helpful, most speak English and the hotel couldn't be in a better location for vising the lakes. Breakfast was included in the price.

We stayed here as part of a Rick Steves tour. This hotel seems frozen in time... appearing very 1950s or 1960s, but it was fun (and I liked the look of it all). The rooms were very spacious (with tubs in the bathrooms). The lobby was HUGE and it had a good bar with an outside deck. It's all nestled in the woods above the falls (though you can't see the falls from any rooms). We had both a dinner and a breakfast in the dininng "hall"... and the food was typical eastern European ("heavy" but generous). There is an ATM almost next door.
reviews.title: Communist Era Hotel but very nice...

reviews.text: A short walk takes you to a shuttle where you can go to the upper falls and then walk back.
reviews.title: Good, solid hotel

reviews.text: It reminds me of a hotel from the communist era, but it's very functional and in a good location. There are lots of steps to climb, and no elevator, so be warned. The food is decent, good enough!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but without airconditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in the Plitvice Hotel late June. The room was big very clean and functional, but unfortunately there was no airconditioning and the temperature was almost 30 degrees.
